Articles.Content: hey i am new to kps. i have seen streamers with a mod that adds clouds to kerban. what mod is that?
so does it just add clouds and lights to just kerban right? not all planets.

It adds clouds to all atmospheres (Kerbin, Duna, Eve, Jool and Laythe) and city lights to Kerbin.

However there are extra packs that use EVE to add things like dust storms to Duna, fog to Minmus and many more.
ok i just wanted to make sure it didnt add lights to other planets besides kerban. thx

Even if it did it is very easy to remove the lights.

The lights for Kerbin for example are in a separate folder. Delete that folder and the lights are gone but the clouds stay.

alright awesome. hey i am not a pc tech. but i was planing on adding the planet shine mod, the interstellar V2 mod, and the clouds and lights. am i adding a lot of stress to my system by doing so?

Edited January 6, 2015 by YETII
I don't use CityLights part of EVE. They flicker and ruin my framerate. Clouds are enough for me.

FYI, while EVE adds clouds they are very rudimentary. EVE is more of an interface for others to add clouds and textures. I recommend Astronomer's Visual Pack, but Better Atmospheres is also popular. Both of those use EVE.

ok thank you

Simply trying will yield quicker answers than a forum post will do.

ok thank you

now i am reading the comments on this mod. and seems to be a lot of issues with it. can anyone confirm this mod works fine or not?

There were some issues with PlanetShine and Sun flares in 0.90 for AVP. PlanetShine was updated. Lens Flares not working isn't going to really break anything, still worth it.
